intro: Puya, commonly known as the "torch cactus," is a genus of flowering plants native to South America. These plants are characterized by their tall, spiny stems and dense clusters of brightly colored flowers, often resembling torches. Puya species are typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. They are known for their long flowering period, which can last several months. The genus includes over 100 species, many of which are popular in horticulture for their striking appearance.
